reasoning: The transcription provides a step-by-step guide on how to prepare and cook string beans with shallots. The steps are extracted based on the sequence of actions described by Jacques Pepin, from preparing the string beans to sauting them with shallots.
dish_description: The dish is a classic French preparation of string beans (haricots verts) that are trimmed, blanched, and then sauted with shallots in butter and oil. The dish is meant to be served as a garnish for meats such as rack of lamb or steak.

cooking_steps.description: Trim the ends of the string beans, removing the piece that was attached to the plant and any remaining strings.
Blanch the string beans in boiling salted water until they are cooked to your preference, typically a few minutes until they are slightly firm and crunchy.
Drain the string beans and cool them under cold water to stop the cooking process, then let them dry out.
Peel and finely chop or slice the shallots, depending on your preference for the final dish.
In a skillet, heat a tablespoon of butter with a dash of oil to prevent the butter from burning.
Saut the shallots in the skillet for 30 to 40 seconds on high heat until they begin to cook.
Add the blanched string beans to the skillet with the shallots, season with salt and pepper, and saut until everything is heated through and well mixed.
Serve the sauted string beans with shallots as a garnish for a main dish such as a rack of lamb or a steak.
